title: Mr. Magkaisa
author: Mr. Magkaisa
content: Good day to all the members here in this forum, if you remember I made a topic here where I taught my neighbor's basic features about Bitcoin to young adults who came to my humble home and this is the link https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5408842.0 Now after these first session these young in mind told me that they will find a way to follow my teaching again, almost 1 month has passed because the rest of them have a hectic schedule in school and others are at work.And here it is, one day these young people came to my home before dinner and I didn't expect them to ask me if I could continue with the second session and of course I said, yes why not... So I was teaching them about bitcoin. And on this occasion, I started familiarizing them with the introduction of bitcoin trading with a simple explanation in our language of course.And this is where I watched a video tutorial with them that teaches what the first step they should do in entering trading,  where they must first know how to create an account on a crypto exchange and Binance tutorial was the best for this,  I watched on them and how to deposit and withdraw from the exchange to our local currency to one of the wallet apps that we have here via p2p. As you can see in the pictures of this topic.rainy weather dpAfter they watched the video I showed them, I told them to create an account on the Binance exchange so that they would know how to make a way to have Bitcoin. And I also taught them one by one how to grow bitcoin little by little using binance, and how to transfer it to one of our wallet apps here called coinsph that uses cryptocurrencies that they can turn into a business apart from bitcoin trading even in the traditional business method that exists in coinsph's wallet apps, and they had a little more interest in knowing this, which I honestly said to myself that it might be difficult for them to immediately understand this even if I explain it in a simple way, but These young adults really impressed me with the strange eagerness they showed to use and learn about the basic trading they will do using our local wallet apps here.So I taught them about this matter for about 2 hours and they told me that they will contact me via messenger or chat when they will come to my house again because they know that my home is always open to those who are dedicated and determined to learn to know what bitcoin is and how to use it in our lives.I hope it will still help me to support my colleagues here in the cryptocurrency industry so that we can guide these young adults like them in their proper growth here. Thank you again for taking the time to read my crypto teaching series for the young in mind.Good day and bless us all here

comments.author: BitDane
comments.body: Nice follow up teaching, but do you think it not that too early to tackle trading Bitcoin when they had a little grasp of what really Bitcoin is?  They might end up blaming you if ever they failed on their trading venture since they haven't got any fundamental learning of Bitcoin and its market.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: I don't exactly know how old your students are but some of them surely look to be below 18. How do you go about this when setting up and accounts for them on binance. Remember Binance requires verification before using their service. If I am not mistaken, those below 18 are not allowed to trade. How did you manage to bypass that restriction when they were verifying?Quote from: BitDane on September 01, 2022, 08:06:51 PMNice follow up teaching, but do you think it not that too early to tackle trading Bitcoin when they had a little grasp of what really Bitcoin is?  They might end up blaming you if ever they failed on their trading venture since they haven't got any fundamental learning of Bitcoin and its market.Not if he clearly warns them of the risks involved with trading.Trading fucks up everyone, no one comes out a virgin  The only way of learning how to trade is by practicing, getting fucked and then trying to avoid the same mistakes in future. one can't learn only through theory.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Mr. Magkaisa on September 01, 2022, 04:25:02 PMSo I was teaching them about bitcoin. And on this occasion, I started familiarizing them with the introduction of bitcoin trading with a simple explanation in our language of course.Trading can be good and profitable, but newbies to trading are at high risk of losing what they have, just like gambling, only the people that have been trading for a long time have the knowledge and experience to make profit than loss. Hope you let them know about the risk involved in trading?Hope you let them know that trading is entirely different from trading?It would be good to let them know that bitcoin holding is different and better for newbies, especially in this period of bear market that people are expecting bull run already.Quote from: Mr. Magkaisa on September 01, 2022, 04:25:02 PMAnd this is where I watched a video tutorial with them that teaches what the first step they should do in entering trading,  where they must first know how to create an account on a crypto exchange and Binance tutorial was the best for this,  I watched on them and how to deposit and withdraw from the exchange to our local currency to one of the wallet apps that we have here via p2p. As you can see in the pictures of this topic.Hole you let them know the risks involved if having coins on an exchange? That the exchange have full control over their own funds, that it is not their kety, which means it is not their coins on blockchain. Also how exchanges can be hacked. All to let them know that they should not use exchanges for holding, but only for trading, that any inactive funds should be moved to a noncustodial wallet.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: It's good to be able to teach your colleagues about crypto trading but don't forget to also tell them about the risks. Quote from: Mr. Magkaisa on September 01, 2022, 04:25:02 PMAfter they watched the video I showed them, I told them to create an account on the Binance exchange so that they would know how to make a way to have Bitcoin. And I also taught them one by one how to grow bitcoin little by little using binance, But I must say that you gave them a bit of misinformation when you said this. Are you sure that the trades that will be made will be able to make their bitcoins continue to grow little by little?. A lot of people are attracted to trading because they see how people flaunt their profits but I would suggest keeping it long-term rather than trading.You should also tell the risk of hacking in crypto and how to secure the asset, hopefully this will also be in your teaching

comments.author: Danydee72
comments.body: It's a very good thing to teach interested people about cryptos. For me it seems like giving them a first glance to this subject. So go for it.Nevertheless, in my opinion trading cryptos seems not to be the best subject for newbies. There are too many risks to consider. Every risk needs knowhow in order to deal with it. As I see on your pictures, I guess your friends are still young. So no hurry at all.If they really like to get some profits, I would let them learn to do some stock investment (not trading) first. There are some shares (EFT's) which can be called as a blue chip (of course there is never a 100%). Teach about graphs, about losing, time of bying, time of selling, fees, about dca - all that is useful for cryptos too. Most stocks are quite expensive, so holding is anyway better than trading. Trading may begin when knowhow gives a chance to have earnings in trades. Let them use earnings from stocks to buy cryptos later on. No hurry for them. Anyway it's a good idea to diversify things. Not only one crypto, not only one market, not only one technology, etc. I dont' know your friends, so I can't say if you are doing the right way or not, but that's the way I would prefer I would teach my son one day. And the first thing I would teach him: you will lose. Right from the beginning. You really like to do that?

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: You could also introduce them to no-kyc/no mandatory kyc exchanges, look into https://www.kycnot.me/But before anything else, best to teach them good security habits on how to safekeep their crypto e.g.  how to backup, what wallet to choose, what not to click, etc...Lastly, I'm sure you have a life outside crypto space so one way to ease your workload is to introduce them to bitcointalk to read and/or ask further questions-- they could do this in their local board as well.

comments.author: cheezcarls
comments.body: Glad to see a fellow kababayan who is teaching these young adults about trading on Bitcoin. Of course I saw your previous posts about teaching your neighbors about the basic information of Bitcoin and that is a good thing. So the setup is like a simple house party where you get to show them the video tutorials about Bitcoin trading. If that is your thing that really works for you, keep doing it. But make sure that you do not disclose to them on how much assets you have or showing them your hardware wallet with the “keys to the kingdom”. This one reminds me back then when I had this free private mini crypto workshops years ago in various cities. Anyways, keep up the good work.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: The risk involved in trading bitcoin is what is very important to tell the new people we introduce to it because people outside think of the trading as what is very easy and they come with the mindset to make alot money immediately they start and they take alot of unreasonable risk that they are out of the market faster. Education is good, knowledge dissemination include giving the best money management skills.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: You have a good initiative to teach Bitcoin to your neighbor in your previous thread, but I'm sorry I would disagree with your current initiative to teach Bitcoin trading to young adults. Trading courses doesn't only for Bitcoin, so you're actually teach them about basic trading skills. But not everyone will become successful from trading and we're don't know how good you're in trading. It's high risk and not recommended for newbie.Quote from: Potato Chips on September 02, 2022, 12:29:03 PMYou could also introduce them to no-kyc/no mandatory kyc exchanges, look into https://www.kycnot.me/Though I also have high privacy concern, but I don't think it's good to use No KYC exchanges in trading due to less liquidity, maybe Kucoin is just the only option for him.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Great initiative, it's your responsibility now to guide them on the right path in trading to have a security-first before making money.There are so many things that they need to understand first, first the wallet that you've used was the wallet that I've used too, and keep in mind the huge fee for transferring Bitcoin to Binance.  It should always teach or remind them not to hold Bitcoin on any custodial wallets or exchange. I'm afraid that someday they will blame you once they will encountered failure, the same that happened to me when I teach my sister about trading.Don't forget to tell them the possible negative consequences when they're in that stage (it will help you not to blame yourself when they have failed in trading), not only focus on the profit.

comments.author: gunhell16

comments.author: Piesel
comments.body: I commend your effort to teach people around you about cryptocurrency trading, I will like to recommend you a few possible ways to start since from your post those your friends do not know cryptocurrency so at best you should start by teaching them about the wallet and how to choose the best wallet with security.Also instead of using binance which has an age restriction for those under 🔞 because it is an exchange why not choose peer-to-peer as the teaching formula since it also teaches about privacy and security instead of an exchange that does not give you keys to your wallet?

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: A good idea, OP. I read your earlier article in earlier about teaching your neighbors about cryptocurrencies, and you have since kept up the teaching. Your zeal in educating this young adults on this has really impressed me. Since they are always open and willing to learn from you, you must be a great teacher. We appreciate you giving them the opportunity to learn from start and guiding them step by step rather than just convincing them of the greater picture (benefits and earnings) of trading bitcoin. Additionally, try to educate them about the risks involved and the best ways to protect their wallets from theft or fraud. I hope they realise the benefits in investing in bitcoin soon.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: This is good. Just always be careful about what information you will give to them because sometimes others misinterpret what comes out of our mouths. I have two oldies who are my drinking buddies here in our place and we discussed a lot of things on Sunday nights. There are times I already discussed Bitcoin with them and I am always careful about telling the risk it has either in trading or investing because of the volatility. Now the other one is hooked on the idea and I try to guide him as much as possible if he has questions. Even if sometimes he just repeats himself, I try to be patient to explain it step by step. You will need a lot of that patience. Good luck.
